meanings.sent1: She would always wyte her brother for any mess in their room.
meanings.sent2: It is not fair to wyte someone without any evidence.
meanings.sent3: The cat would wyte the dog for knocking over the water bowl.
meanings.sent4: The storm wyted the trees for bending and breaking under its force.
meanings.sent5: The teacher would wyte the students for not completing their homework on time.

meanings.sent1: The wyte for the broken vase fell on the clumsy cat.
meanings.sent2: In the court of law, the wyte was placed on the negligent driver.
meanings.sent3: The wyte of the burnt cookies was humorously blamed on the oven's rebellious mood.
meanings.sent4: The wyte of the failed project lay heavy on the team leader's shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The wyte of the leaky faucet was finally fixed by the plumber.
